title: Comments: Notes for Humans
simplifierConcept:
Imagine you're leaving notes in a cookbook: "This recipe is spicy!" or "Mom's favorite!". These notes help YOU, but they don't change the recipe itself.

Comments in C# work the same way! They're notes for humans (including your future self) that the computer completely ignores. There are two types:

1. Single-line comments: // Everything after these slashes is ignored
2. Multi-line comments: /* Everything between these is ignored */

Good programmers use comments to explain WHY they wrote code, not just WHAT the code does. Future you will thank present you!

syntaxBreakdown.explanation: Everything after // on that line is ignored. Quick notes go here!
Everything between /* and */ is ignored, even across multiple lines. Good for long explanations.
Comments explain your thinking: "This loop finds the highest score" is better than just reading the code!

challenge.hint: Use Console.WriteLine for each line of your art, and add // comments above each line to explain it!
commonStickingPoints: Forgetting that comments are for HUMANS, not the computer – they don't do anything to your code!
Using /* to start a comment but forgetting */ to close it – everything after becomes a comment!
Writing comments that just repeat the code: // Display text is not helpful. // Display welcome message to user is better!
